synopsis.text:
Kao Corporation's Asience shampoo creative challenge birthed a visually captivating animated short film, titled Asience: Hairy Tale, masterfully directed by Kazuto Nakazawa, renowned for his work in Quentin Tarantino's Kill Bill: Vol. 1. The narrative revolves around the Japanese proverb, 'Hair is the heart of a woman,' and is beautifully depicted as a tragic love story set in a samurai era. The young protagonist, driven by love, uses his beloved's hair to ascend to her, but their bond faces a severe test when her father forbids their union.

The animation, produced by Production I.G, boasts a unique graphic style reminiscent of 18th-century Japanese paintings, with character designs and animation direction by Nakazawa himself. The artwork, further enhanced by Shuichi Hirata's textural prowess, is characterized by intricate brush lines meticulously hand-drawn by the in-between staff, devoid of any 3D animation support. This visually stunning film explores the depths of a woman's heart through her hair, promising a poignant tale of love, loss, and resilience.
